website_summaries.verdict: The Sony BDP-N460's attractive mix of Blu-ray performance, relatively low price, and streaming media options--including Netflix--make it a solid midrange pick, despite some missing features.
pros: Excellent image quality on Blu-ray movies
streams Netflix, Amazon Video On-Demand, YouTube, Slacker, and NPR
relatively inexpensive given its suite of streaming features
onboard decoding for Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio
cons: no eject button on the remote
many Internet content channels feature outdated content

customer_reviews.title: A new blu-ray player that's missing old features!
customer_reviews.text: Great player / wimpy remote(no back-light)! This player plays Blu-rays great and the audio is awesome! I also love the NetFlix streaming video! I do it wirelessly using the recommended Linksys wifi extender, which I bought refurbished on Amazon. But... my old Samsung dual format(Blur-ray/HDVD) player had a sharper picture. Also it's missing buttons on the remote, one to open the tray and another to random play music tracks(that feature is not available with this player). Also, you can't play music tracks through the front USB slot, only photos. Sony! What were you thinking? Overall, if you just want to watch Blu-rays, and NetFlix movies, it's a great player.
customer_reviews.author: Z-Shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: My first blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player & can't believe what this machine does. It plays with an incredible picture & great sound. But when you connect it online, you get another world. Music, videos, you tube, Netflix & more. I have not signed up for Netflix yet, but everything else is great! Easy set-up for this machine. The only difference is if you want the full effect, connect a flash drive ( I'm using an 8GB ) & your ethernet connection (Can't use a phone connection) & everything opens up for you. You can also play your own home made dvd's or music. Makes your older dvd's look better & upscales to HD. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Klipp

customer_reviews.title: OK for the money; Netflix still doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Nice picture quality. When you shut down power in the middle of a movie, it forgets everything and you have to start over. Netflix worked a couple of times. Now I always get an error message: DRM-1 (Digital Rights Management). Netflix says it's Sony's problem. Sony says their engineers are working on it. It's had two software updates so far (most recent installed Dec. 23, 2009) with no fix. Other internet content works fine. If I didn't already get Netflix on my TiVo I would return the Sony. Update: After 2 firmware updates, Netflix finally works (sometime in 2010). Works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not For The Stream-ish (Netflix)
customer_reviews.text: (Sorry, I couldn't resist the wordplay with "squeamish.") This player just wouldn't run Netflix properly; the picture would freeze again and again as it stopped streaming to rebuild its buffer -- displaying the message: "Loading...." -- sometimes every minute or so. After support calls to Sony, Netflix and Comcast, I returned it and purchased an LG BD-550, which runs Netflix almost perfectly. The problem was clearly with the BDP-N460 (although my new LG will occasionally rebuffer when my network download speed drops to around 3-4 Mbps). So, if Netflix is important to you, I'd avoid this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Humbug Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Wow-this thing is easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how simple this was to use. I purchased the Linksys Wireless N bridge with this product and after that quick set up, I hook it up to the BD player and 5 minutes later I was watch a good quality film streamed through Netflix. Sony should have included a 1GB thumb drive as they are probably as cheap as the batteries included with the remote control. Additionally, future model should have built in wireless capability. BD playback quality is very good and no more disk skipping issues I had with some Netflix BD. Besides these two shortcomings, I am very please with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mulv

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and looks nice next to the TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player about 5 years ago and it's still going strong, survived my college dorm for 3 years and now my girlfriend uses it. Easy to use and looks nice next to the TV.
customer_reviews.author: M.K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works OK when it does work! (also no wifi)
customer_reviews.text: I've had this player for sometime, a little over a year. But it has had issues the whole time and now the BD has burned out. I had to go back to my older model(2 years older) to substitute until I find a QUALITY replacement. It has issues with slow action when you use your remote(didn't realize how bad until I put my old model back on) and loading is lethargic at best. I also use a lens dust cleaner disc on all my equipment which keeps them working well. I upgraded from my other Sony because I liked most of the features. Big mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Frayed Knot

customer_reviews.title: Netflix playback jerky with certain Sony BRAVIA TV settings
customer_reviews.text: Netflix playback was jerky and unwatchable on our Sony BRAVIA TV, but turning off the "CineMotion" feature solved the problem for both SD and HD Netflix video playback. The Netflix user interface on this unit is not as nice as on the Roku or the PS3. For example, you can't browse for new movies; you can only view your Netflix Instant queue. On other Netflix players, when you rewind or fast-forward you get snapshot previews along the way, but with this player it only shows you the time with no way to tell when to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Leah

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Have used it many, many times in its first 12 months. Quality of the picture on a Samsung LCD is amazing. The only issue was when it would unexpectedly drop the Netflix signal (I had to restart it). Then it started to lose the signal while playing a blu ray and regular DVDs. Sony's online and telephone support was first class, as expected. They set up my network connection manually and there have been no issues with dropped online or off line signals since.
customer_reviews.author: I. Patcherezov

customer_reviews.title: Great for old folks
customer_reviews.text: This machine is wonderful! Very easy to set up, hooking up to the internet and downloading new firmware was very easy, even for an old guy like me who doesn't understand too much of all this stuff. Netflix setup was easy, although you have to go back and forth a bit with passwords. Netflix streaming was easy and good quality. Startup speed is better than I expected. Blue Ray movies are outstanding! Get the HDMI cables, much better than component video cables.
customer_reviews.author: ROF

customer_reviews.title: ok while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It was an ok blu ray player while it lasted. Pandora on it was nice and I purchased a few Amazon movies. It was very slow in booting up and loading and unloading discs. My first blu ray so I can't compare it to others. Only 1 star because it died in 12 months. Used very little. Iv'e never had luck with Sony products, nor Panasonic. Never had issues with Samsung, if I get a replacement it will be a Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Chad D. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460 Review
customer_reviews.text: Amazing internet connection - nice organization of sites and ease of accessing videos from internet. Setup was a breeze (I have direct ethernet connection but am purchasing Linksys/Cisco wireless bridge to allow other computer to use the direct connect). Slow loading reported by other reviews is not a major factor for me. Blu-Ray videos are great (like being in a theater). Upscaling of normal DVDs gives very good appearance on screen. I have a Sony Bravia LCD TV I purchased at same time as the DVD player - combination of two Sony products is great since they allow HDMI commands for turning on and off as well as putting TV into correct input mode.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Good player and good streaming options so far
customer_reviews.text: Only had this about a week and I do like the player. Very nice interface that is similar to a PS3 menu--so much better. DVD load times are faster than my old Panasonic, but still not as fast as a PS3. I'm just streaming things from Netflix right now and it seems OK, but I expected better quality video. Not sure where the limitation is on that and still experimenting. Setup was super easy and no problems to complain about right now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Blu-ray player because it was recommended to me by a friend. I expected it to be great but did not know exactly how great. The biggest advantage for me is that it has Netflix streaming (and having YouTube is nice too, except that the quality isn't superb on the YouTube). It loads fast and movies look amazing on this Blu-ray. I would definitely say buy this over a cheaper Blu-ray. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: sunflowerfusion

customer_reviews.title: Nice Player
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for roughly 6 months and it's been solid. We use it primarily to watch BD/DVDs and on-demand movies from Amazon. The only glitch I've ever seen has been when loading Blu-Ray discs. It can take awhile sometimes but I've had friends tell me that's typical regardless of manufacturer because blu-rays commonly download enhanced content. It's easy to use and delivers a great picture.
customer_reviews.author: JohnPM

customer_reviews.title: Price and Performance
customer_reviews.text: The Sony BDP-N460 Blu-Ray Disc Player delivers on price and performance. It's picture quality is amazing, upconversion from standard DVD content flawless, and Netflix Instant watch, though dependant on our internet services quality as well as demand on Netflix servers, approaches DVD quality and beyond at times (does not happen often but a treat when it does.) The internet setup is a bit complicated with the entry of various parameters and addresses, and is not plug and play but once setup delivers a variety of internet entertainment sources. A computer network savvy installer is necessary to hook it up without frustration, failure, and a great deal of hassle. Bottom line: excellent price and performance!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn M

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray planer
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this player after reading other reviews and after purchasing a HD tv that we wanted to take advantage of the technology. This player was easy to hook up. No issues. I would say the best part is what it does to regular DVD's. It actually has the ability to improve the quality of regular DVDs when played look like Blu-ray quality video. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ceglio

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was using my PS3 for Bluray, but wanted a dedicated player for ease of use for the rest of the family (yes, the PS3 is easy to use, but I have a universal remote and dealing with the bluetooth converter can be a headache at times), not to mention I didn't want to burn out my PS3 watching movies all the time. This is a great player for the price. The only thing I overlooked was the wireless connectivity, but it isn't a showstopper since my router is on top of my entertainment center. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick L. Cloud

customer_reviews.title: BDP-N460
customer_reviews.text: I'd been reluctant to invest in the blu ray format for a few years as standards, features, and quality/value were constantly in development, but having finally pulled the trigger on this unit I must say that I'm very satisfied with the N460! I've found this blu ray player to be an excellent value, and its overall quality (image, sound, build, styling, user interface) is impressive for a product in it's price range. It's network streaming capability is an added bonus for me, and it offers enormous potential as more internet viewable content becomes available. The only drawback for me (a minor one) is the lack of an eject button on the remote. I'd recommend this unit for consideration without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: If it streamed Hulu, it would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: We've had this player for about a week now and we love it! It was easy to set up and update. The picture is stunning, it streams Netflix in HD, Amazon VOD, streams YouTube and a few other things. If it streamed Hulu, it would be absolutely perfect - that's why I only gave it 4 stars. I hope they add that in the future. For the price, this Blu Ray player cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: First Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I finally took the plunge & went Blu Ray this Christmas. I was glad to wait. The Sony unit is everything it was promised to be and more. The load time is excellent. I had gone HD-DVD 2 years ago & even though the picture quality is comparable to blu ray the load times were ridiculous. I would recomment this unit in regard to quality & pricing for all concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We used to own and Olevia blu-ray player and this is fantastic in comparison! Has an awesome and very detailed menu set-up and loads much faster than our old blu-ray player- which gave us enough time to make dinner before it would fully load. This one on the other hand is fairly quick and the picture is great! Highly recommended especially at this price~!
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Picture is amazing, Go Blue Ray!
customer_reviews.text: We have been holding out for awhile on Blue Ray, using our xbox 360 for dvd's. We bought this player and we love it. First movie we bought was Avatar, and it almost looks better than the theatre. Took a little bit to get used to working it, but once we did, it was worth the money. Even our regular dvd's look great! I would recommend this player highly.
customer_reviews.author: theshenrys

customer_reviews.title: Flawless BD Player
customer_reviews.text: I have been using mine for 2 weeks. Installation & setup could not have been easier - didn't even crack the manual. Netflix registration took less than a minute. Fast loading. Only problem related to programming my DishTV remote to control the BDP-N460. None of the Sony codes seem to work. I think that is certainly a problem with the DishTV remote.
customer_reviews.author: Fornaio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price...Excellent product! Highly Recommended...
customer_reviews.text: My first Blu-Ray ever and I am enjoying it a lot!! I set it up in 10 mins, 10 mins more for Netflix and Pandora sync and after that... completely satisfaction. The DVD upscaling is great and wait until you play blu-ray movies like Avatar or Up! It rocks!! I'm using it with my SONY Bravia and only gets better and better as I learn how to use its many many bonus features. Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: CJ24Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Netflix HD let this player down
customer_reviews.text: This player works wonderful as the sony featured products. Also products such as Slacker Radio and Amazon Video Online are work well (except Amazon looses the liscense on purchased movies after a period of time - but their customer service worked with me). ...but Netflix promotes video when you want, where you want kind of concept, but their current or new release movies in HD is truly a let down. I bought this player and subscribed to Netflix only to be let down by Netflix's product (not Sony). ...maybe we'll get monthly subscription service where we can view New Release Movies in HD (or 3D) before the end of this Century.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, although probably outdated now...
customer_reviews.text: A little slow on the boot up, but a solid player. The interface could use a little updating, like getting language and subtitle options on Netflix would be nice. I have them on my phone, why not on the BD player? Anyway, works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This Sony Networked Blue Disc Player is a great product. The picture quality is stunning. Streaming with Netflix and YouTube (among others) a breeze. Practically no set-up time (i did already have a network bridge installed, so that made it a little easier). Quick online firmware upgrades. Can't say enough good things about this product. Plus, it looks really cool sitting on top of my DVR.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Connecting and setup was easy and simple. The N460 found the network connection immediately. Connecting to Netflix was easy, but did require registering at Sony and activating with a code at the Netflix web page. I cannot comment on the Blue Ray quality, we do not have a 1080P HDTV, but the picture quality at 1080I is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Cushman Ken

customer_reviews.title: Sony (fun) BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disc player- FUN!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this for under a week and love it. no more pay per view through the cable company... We have a samsung 42" 720 ppi TV- everything looks GREAT on it.. The setup of the player was easy, I was able to instantly watch netflix, fast loading, with no problems. Netflix was clear, crisp, sound was good. Blu-ray discs are amazing... had to move our speakers around a little in order to appreciate the sounds. listening to the "slacker" radio station that loads with this machine- great! If I ever have problems I may change my review, but so far, fun fun fun!
customer_reviews.author: A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Far better then the wireless version
customer_reviews.text: All the Reviews I researched on the internet were right on the money. Just make sure you get a HDMI cable to make it top notch (although that is true for any blu-ray player). I simply purchased a Monster Powernet 200 kit and everything streams flawlessly. I can't wait to set up my next home theater system. So fun and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Kris B

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews on the Sony BDP-N460 player from people having picture quality problems with Netflix and other internet streaming services. I hooked the player up hardwired to the internet provided from Comcast, through a Docsys 3.0 compatible cable modem and router. The download speed [...] through these connections is significantly above the 2-3 Mbps minimum specified by Sony. The picture quality has been flawless. Likewise, the picture quality for DVD upconversion and Blu-ray play has been as advertised. Definitely a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Napa Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming Netflix movies
customer_reviews.text: This Sony Player does all that it is advertised to do. For Streaming netflix movies it is best to plug the wire from the router directly into the sony player. I did buy the suggested Cisco access point but after 20 or 30 minutes it drops the signal which is a common complaint at the Cisco support site.
customer_reviews.author: Paul in MD

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go along with the Linksys by Cisco Dual-Band Wireless-N Gaming and Video Adapter. Once setup wirelessly it connected to Netflix, YouTube and all these other features allowing you to view so many cool things. My wife started checking out a vacation video section. It was much faster than the previous Sony BDP-S350 1080p Blu-ray Disc Player I had got for the father in law the previous Christmas and a lot cheaper. How quickly the price drops and quality improves. After completing setup of all the features I asked my father and law when we should expect our invite to come back over and enjoy this thing. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ian N. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Average Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back at the end of 2009 and I have never really had any problems with it. I have always thought that Sony makes high quality products. The only note is that the disc spinning up and the associated vibration does create a bit more noise than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Device works great with DVDs. Blu-rays work perfect as expected. Have not tried Netflix yet as I need to run a CAT-5 cable. I do not know why a wireless receiver was not included in the design, or on any Blu-ray player for that matter. Great product, easy set up, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit as a replacement for a Samsung player that died on me within 2 weeks. So far, my Sony hasn't let me down! Quick loading time, nice DVD upscaling ability, and having access to Netflix, Slacker, YouTube, etc.......very nice! Once in a blue moon, I have has a few issues with movies streamed from Netflix needing to rebuffer, but I'm thinking that is most likely caused by the Netflix servers (I have the unit hard wired to the internet, and it's pulling down 20 to 25 Mbps speed-wise, so....). My overall opinion.......very good unit, espicially for the price! Let's hope it keeps working!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Bought this since it was advertised as everything a ps3 is but the gaming. Blue rays load quickly. I only gave it a 3 on upscaling as I haven't really had a chance to try it much. I was really interested in the Amazon Unboxed capability and other net streaming capabilities. Have used the Amazon service once and was greatly pleased with it (no subscrption and time limit), would only wish I could stream content from my PC.
customer_reviews.author: D. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: viewing Netflix: freezes unit
customer_reviews.text: We had Roku and loved it but our dvd player needed replacing so we found Sony BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disc Player . We are hard wired into the player so you would think things would run smoothly. When viewing Netflix movies, almost every one stops and we have to get out of it and then go back and hit resume. Sometimes the unit freezes and we have to unplug it then restart in order to finish viewing. My husband feels it is a NetFlix problem as this only happens with NetFlix. Me, I am not so sure.......is anybody else having this problem?
customer_reviews.author: M. Ott

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Player and Streamer!
customer_reviews.text: Use mostly for streaming Netflix and Amazon. Sony adds new streaming services on a regular basis. I have a fast Ethernet connection. I haven't had any buffering problems in over a year. DVDs play smoothly. No hardware issues. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great BluRay Player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Dad as his first BluRay player. The player was easy to setup and not too difficult to use (wish Sony would further streamline their menu system). The picture quality was really great and that's what I was looking for in moderately priced player. Didn't test the internet/Netflix connectivity. Would recommend as a entry level high quality BluRay player.
customer_reviews.author: S. Springer

customer_reviews.title: A really good product.
customer_reviews.text: We use this product daily and have no complaints. It works best when purchasing and using the HDMI cable. A really great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T. Papson

customer_reviews.title: "Cheap at twice the price"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit primarily for its a ability to stream internet and was pleasantly surprised to see how much I got for my money. Not only does it live up to my expectations for the internet use but it's initial purpose, to play blu-ray discs is superb. I shopped extensively before making my decision and as with other Sony products it has exceeded my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John Gentry

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to play Blue ray discs BD-R But fail to play them and other formats, The cheapest Sony DVP-SR370 was able to play the BD disks.NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: Daniel .C. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: We love this Blu-Ray player. We bought it as a secondary player for the bedroom and it has worked out great. For some reason, I thought it had the Wi-FI built in, but it does not. To get Wi-Fi, you have to purchase a separate Wi-FI wireless bridge. It turned out better for me because it forced me to hardwire the player, which gives me faster streaming and downloading. Purchasing the network cable was cheaper than buying a wireless bridge and running the cable turned out to be quicker than I thought. The unit is very user friendly and the Netflix interface is great. Overall, very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: A. Farish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Blu-ray player for 6 months now and I am completely satisfied with my purchase. The picture quality is perfect and the cross bar menu to me is an improvement over other menus, the setting are clear and plentiful. Internet capabilities are excellent. My main concern was Netflix and it plays perfectly (I have extended internet speed which probably helps). Load time is quick and you are notified of updates and they are quick to install. Overall a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pelvin Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Great Picture
customer_reviews.text: Without reading the instructions I had it installed and playing content from Amazon video on demand in 15 minutes. I have the Samsung 50 inch 780p plasma and I think picture quality was superb. Blu-ray and DVD as well. Well done, Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding network blueray player
customer_reviews.text: Got this player so I could stream Amazon-on-Demand content as well as Netflix. All the additional internet channels were just the icing on the cake. Works well with my wireless system but will hardwire with ethernet for fast broadband speed. Plays both my BD and DVDs well. Could not have asked for a better product...I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine Blu-ray player. We've never had any problems with it and it does play discs without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: KristenTag

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how good it is yet
customer_reviews.text: The Blu-ray I was sent did not work at all. The tray would not open. What really frustrated me was the run arounD from Sony customer service. It took a couple of tries to have someone finally decide I needed to send it back, but then it took 2 tries to get the labels needed to send it back. I expect much better quality and customer service from Sony. FYI I purchased this product over 3 weeks ago and I have at least another week to wait until I finally get to watch a movie (assumming the next one works).
customer_reviews.author: Harriet Rabenovets

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Had for less 2 years, with last update from Sony Blu Ray no longer works. Spent over 1 hour on phone with Customer Service with no resolution. Found other reviews online with same issue. Poor service from Sony, also no way to revert back o previous version.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernMade

customer_reviews.title: Some of the newer toys out there don't have all ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the newer toys out there don't have all the outlets that are needed for older amps so I went old school with this one and Its just what was needed.
customer_reviews.author: jeffery C. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice player that works as described. Does fantastic blu ray with my 720p projector. You can really see the difference with the big screen. Netflix has been a problem so far, first night I was able to stream a movie, but haven't been able to log in since. Having to go through Sony has been the problem. Having to turn on and off player and ejecting disc manually has been the only mechanical inconvenience, but happy with player otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Netflix streaming yields better quality than direct to computer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product in my house for a month now and am more than happy with the picture quality in any mode. Most netflix movies streamed to the device look nearly as good as a blu-ray disc on my Sony Bravia TV. I thought this would be a good product but it went well beyond my expectations and the Netflix streaming is just the thing for these snowy weekends we have been having recently.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac J. Webb III

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this unit. The upscaling does seem to make a noticeable improvement on non-HD DVDs. The menu system is more like a computer GUI than an old-fashioned disc player.
customer_reviews.author: HikingInSierras

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 100% for me
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure what I wanted..Have Sony products,,Wanted to View NetFlex Excellent... At&t 2.5 mpbs.Avg..no pauses or restarts..perfect... Lots of free stuff..Youtube cool...Easily recommended, Sony previews of Movies...Definatly worth it..Had the use to the wireless bridge, Used the recommended excellent 5 stars.....
customer_reviews.author: Reynoldsvillage

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluray Player, but poor interface.
customer_reviews.text: The product is quite good. The only down side of the product are the interfaces for services such as Netflix and Youtube. I was surprised since it's a Sony product, because PS3 has such a user friendly interface for those sites.
customer_reviews.author: George Maggessy

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disc Player (Black)
customer_reviews.text: So they even have this model anymore? If so it's worked GREAT for me. I've reccomended this exact player to several friends & family too.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Born Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: We have an older model Sony blu-ray player, and it is extremely slow loading. We were nervous about purchasing another, but this is totally different! It loads very quickly, and the features are amazing. We've had it a month and have only watched blu-rays, watched Netflix streaming videos and gone to You Tube, but those features that we have used were great. I'm looking forward to playing around with everything else on there.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Bought For Netflix Streaming mainly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a blu-ray player that could stream netflix, that was my only requirement. I hard wired this one to my router and after a simple update I was streaming netflix, it works great. The blu-ray player part works well, controls are intuitive, so it does not eject from remote, who cares !
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Sony scores a winner
customer_reviews.text: I'm still using it and its works just fine. No issues to the point and I have used it pretty regularly for 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Roark C. Herron

customer_reviews.title: Great player,glad I finally went Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: Felt like it was time to update my very old Dvd player & am so glad I did.Blu-ray movies of course look incredible but the thing that impresses me the most is the upscaling of my old Dvd movies,the picture quality is very,very good on them.The Netflix streaming was also one of the key features I was looking for and it is probably the one of our favorite things,we use it almost every day!!I am very happy with this player and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brack D. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: This device works well and completely met my expectations. The interface is Sony's usual XMB, which works well with the Blu-ray player. Blu-rays looked amazing, and even DVDs were impressive with the player's upscaling. The internet video features are nice options, although it can be cumbersome searching something on YouTube with a remote, especially without predictive suggestions. Over all, I was satisfied with this device.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: WARNING....DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK! I GO THROUGH TWO OF THEM AND BOTH DIE LESS THAN A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I bougth this model from Amazon.com in June 2010. It work fine in the first few months. Then it started to hang and wont read the DVD. It stopped working totally after 6 months. We requested an exchange. They sent us a refurbished one in late Oct 2010. It only has 3-month warranty on it. The refurbished player stopped working in July 2011. We're very disappointed with this product. We have something less pricey before and it last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda E. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great, no issues or problems. Nice piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: turbodiesel97

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The Blu-Ray player has exceeded my expectations with the ease at which you can watch netflix movies and other media from the internet. The few Blu-Ray movies I watched were amazing also. This is the first Blu-Ray unit I have so I did not rate the Load/Start up speed (I have no comparsion). I wanted to upgrade to a Blu-Ray player, but was waiting to see about the additional media. Sony has made a nice unit, would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. ONeil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I received the player two weeks before XMAS and my wife and I and love it. The Netflix part is very good, i like the user interface, very simple and straight forward. We have cable for an internet connection, so speed is not a problem. Blu-ray movies are soooo good..... DVD movies that i have watched so far look great, much better than with my regular dvd player, so i guess the DVD upscaling really make a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: RI Red.

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460
customer_reviews.text: Set up and integration into my home network was easy (if you already have a Linksys WiFi bridge). Somewhat slow loading but better than previous models. Picture and sound are great. NetFlix streaming is relatively poor quality looking more like a VHS tape. Need to investigate further since it may be my high speed provider bandwidth ... wireless antennae.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sedlacek

customer_reviews.title: sony blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: am very happy with this dvd player, picture is great, watching a regular DVD... when watching a blu-ray DVD.....wow! quik sale and shipping from amazon, pleased with their service. only [minor] thing with this sony player is that i'm unable to connect to internet to see if any updates might be needed, so hope i'm not missing out on some new feature, but bottom line, i feel i spent my hard earned money well.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: remarkably good for a used item
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, remarkably good for a used item......because.....SONY.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Whitelocke

customer_reviews.title: very impressed with this DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this device primarily for the streaming Netflix feature, which I have used daily to occupy my 2 year old, but I also find myself using the integrated youtube and slacker radio often. Very simple interface to use. I would highly recommend this device to anyone looking to upgrade their DVD player and add some networked streaming services to the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Clendenin

customer_reviews.title: This unit really hit the spot
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another brand blu ray only to have problems that ultimately put me in the market for a new one. After reading many reviews I decided upon this unit. I loved the surround sound and the picture has been nothing but stellar. The only thing I mis is a remote activated open/close door mode; this one is manual operated. Other than that, I love this blu ray player. I hope it will give years of great service.
customer_reviews.author: wingedlion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality & Picture
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Samsung, Panasonic & Sony Blu-Ray players before finally settling on this one. The quality of picture and sound is much better from the Sony than by Samsung or Panasonic. Controls are fairly easy to use, much faster loading than the other Bluray players. I've not yet tried the NetFlix streaming. Overall an excellent player.
customer_reviews.author: Murali K. Nagulakonda

customer_reviews.title: what they didn't say...
customer_reviews.text: works good..i like it, and it does what they claim. What i had to find out the hard way is it has no browser. it has a net flix " channel" ( and more) but you cannot type in a web address and "go" anywhere . I also had to register it with sony before it would allow me to register with netflix ....i dont know why. Tybeenian
customer_reviews.author: Tybeenian

customer_reviews.title: Sony blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: Sony has always been my favorite, great product has been in my Rv for a year on some of the worst roads and is still great.
customer_reviews.author: raymond f wood

customer_reviews.title: Quick Play, Upscale, It's A Sony!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product... I've been using Sony products for over 20 years. Never had a problem with any DVD, CD player, of surround system I've had. So a Sony Blu-ray player was the next logical step. Great buy for the money!
customer_reviews.author: L. Riley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great blu-ray - great online features
customer_reviews.text: I like that through software updates Sony keeps tehir online features up to date, adding interesting content.
customer_reviews.author: The Ton

customer_reviews.title: My SONY
customer_reviews.text: So far good. I have good picture, sound and the streaming on Netflix is good. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Ed Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Good old school blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a player with RCA audio outputs... this one worked great for connecting to my stereo preamplifier and amp.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Glembourtt

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the machine, especially with the network connection and ability to upgrade the firmware and add new services. Worked so well, I bought a new 7.1 tuner and large screen Sony TV to go with it and love the HDMI interconnection control function.
customer_reviews.author: A happy user

customer_reviews.title: Netflix streaming - Love it! Awesome Blu ray disc player with online streaming
customer_reviews.text: Wow.. what to say.. a great blu ray disc player with netflix streaming. Love the quality of picture and sound when play blu ray discs or netflix streaming. I am glad that I bought this. Excellent product from Sony. I would definitely recommend it. Worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dodda

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good dvd player with all the ideal features. I haven't streamed with it yet or used a regular DVD but I've watched several blu-ray dvds and they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, great quality. Just what I was looking for. I would definitely recommend it and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player primarily for Netflix streaming. However, I had nothing but trouble with this product. HD programing would constantly pause to reload. Standard steaming was ok. I checked several times with Sony, Netflix, and Comcast. No one could figure out the problem. Sony insisted their product was working fine. So, I returned the Sony for a new Sony replacement. Same problem. I sent the second one back also and got an LG BD-390. No problems with the LG streaming Netflix. The LG works great. Also, the Netflix interface with the Sony is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scheibel

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray player review
customer_reviews.text: The netflix streaming capability has been great on this player. The setup was simple and I have not had any video quality issues at all. Overall I am extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Received this UPS, hooked it up to the HDMI cable that was connected to my Samsung HDTV, popped in a Blu-Ray movie, and I was watching it in less than 10 seconds. So far I am happy with this player. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Goldeneye89

customer_reviews.title: Streaming horrible, video quaility good
customer_reviews.text: Have had continuous issues with streaming netflix. Rebooting (about every 90 mins of viewing) helps some, as does resetting to factory defaults, but those are both temporary fixes. Talked to netflix support 2-3 times, rebooted many times. Rebooted my router/modem several times as well. After reading other reviews, I inserted a USB drive (thumb drive) in back, and that seems to have helped (watched about 3 hrs of Netflix since, seems to have fixed it, which makes me think Sony skimped on the memory buffer). BTW, several other devices (wireless laptop, ipad; wired desktop PC) all work fine on same internet connection, even at same time as this wired POS blu ray player buffers.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Mott

customer_reviews.title: Bought it because of good reviews and I wasn't disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am an mature man in his upper 60s whom is as a far from a geek as a person can get. Was looking for a Blue-Ray player that would allow for me to access the internet for movies and vidios. This player fits the bill and unlike many rescent purchases this one exceeded expectation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coletta

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with this Blu-ray player.I found the picture quality even sharper than the excellent video from my up-converting DVD player. After hooking up an internet connection (hardwire), the unit detected and downloaded firmware updates automatically. I have watched Netflix and Amazon movies, Youtube videos and listened to music. This product upgraded my DVD playing capability and brought streaming video to my hi-def TV. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great BD player for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This BD player loads BD's fast and displays BD's better than any other BD player I have personally viewed. It also performs an excellent job of upscaling standard DVD's. Some of my higher quality DVD's appear to be displayed at near BD resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Epicurus

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Blue-ray player
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is great. It is fast and the picture is great. I also set up Netflix to steam movies and tv shows. It really is amazing how quickly it does the process and how good the picture quality is. The representative at Sony was very helpful in helping me set up the procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu Ray with Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great! Easy to set up the wireless connection to my home network. Easy to set up the netflix account access. Fantastic Picture. One day I might even watch a Blu Ray on it.
customer_reviews.author: SimonRim

customer_reviews.title: Works great w Netflix streaming
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Sony Blu-ray player I have. I upgraded for the internet streaming capability and the system works great thru may cable provider. The DVD upscaling is very good also. I highly recommend this item to others. Installing and linking to Netflix was not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rich A

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blu-ray for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice player, good picture quality on both Blu-ray and DVD. However, considering the original cost of this player, I can't believe that Sony cheaped up the remote and did not put an eject button on it.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: sony bluray
customer_reviews.text: so far very pleased with the player.streamed two movies from amazon that i rented worked very well.perfect delivery from amazon good price great service very happy.
customer_reviews.author: patrick scarry

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disk Play(Black)
customer_reviews.text: The Sony BDP-N460 Is a very good Blue Ray Play. I connected it to my router Usening cable I bought from Amanzon.com and I was recieving Netflix, and Amazon movie on deman.
customer_reviews.author: Norman C. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.text: Nice player to have. I cut my comcast cable off-charging too much, I use the netflix and all the channels the player offers. If I need to watch TV I use my Free Air TV-HD. Buy this player its good to have.
customer_reviews.author: Oneil A. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Sont BDP-N460
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-ray disc player is a good value. The Blu-ray video quality it very good but the upscaling is not as great. Streaming both Netflix and other sources makes this player a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: ehwright

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: This player requires a download speed from your ISP provider of 10Mbps to play streaming video. I have 7Mbps. It stops the movie to load during HD play every few seconds. I tried everything to stop it to no avail. I called Sony and netflix with no solution in site. At least half of the Blue Ray movies I get from netflix have to be exchanged because they are unplayable. Stick to DVD's. Don't buy this player.
customer_reviews.author: Pete the shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, well-functioning unit.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very compact, easy to use, and has very high quality video. We are quite pleased with the unit and the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. H. Davis

product_meta.title: Sony BDP-N460 Blu-ray Disc Player (Black) (2009 Model)
product_meta.description:
Experience Blu-ray Disc movies in Full HD 1080p quality with stunning HD sound that supports enhanced audio formats including Dolby TrueHD and dts-HD Master Audio. You can also play and upscale your DVDs to near high definition. Connect to the internet and instantly stream thousands of movies, videos, music and more from Netflix, YouTube, Slacker and other leading content providers with the Sony BDP-N460 Network Blu-ray Disc player.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Sony BDP-N460 (October 13, 2009)
In addition to playing Blu-ray Discs and DVDs, the Sony BDP-N460 streams one of the largest collections of premium and free on-demand entertainment from the BRAVIA Internet Video platform, including thousands of movies, TV programs, and music from from over 25 leading content providers--including YouTube, Slacker, and Netflix. Simply connect the BDP-N460 to your existing Internet connection. 

 



Stream video from one of the largest collections of premium and free on-demand entertainment, including thousands of movies, TV programs, and music from YouTube, Slacker, and, later this fall, Netflix. 

The Sony BDP-N460 incorporates Sony’s Precision Cinema HD Upscale technology that converts standard-definition signals (480i) to near HD quality (see larger image). It supports Dolby TrueHD and dts-HD audio codecs for up to 7.1 channels of high-definition sound, and there's even quick start-up mode which begins operating your Blu-ray Disc player in approximately six seconds from the time it is powered on. You can also play and upscale your standard DVDs to near high definition. And navigation of the player's menus is a breeze thanks to the icon-based Xross Media Bar (XMB) menu system.



KEY FEATURES
 * Instantly stream thousands of movies, videos and music from an ever-growing list of over 25 content providers including Netflix, Slacker Radio, YouTube and more. (Learn more) 
 * Full HD 1080p Output (Learn more) 
 * DVD Upscaling via HDMI technology: DVD Upscaling via HDMI makes your existing standard DVDs look better on your HDTV by upscaling them to near HD quality. 
 * Dolby TrueHD and dts HD- 7.1 Analog: In the past, most audio codecs used compression that actually removes some sound data to transmit audio from the disc to the audio circuitry. This means that what you hear is a subset of the original audio. However, newer formats allow the audio to be compressed but not discarded, allowing the original audio to come through once it's been decoded. This player allows you to stream the audio out via HDMI to a capable receiver or through analog 7.1 outputs for maximum compatibility with high end receivers. (Learn more) 
 * BD-Live Technology allows you to download and stream bonus content such as additional scenes, shorts, trailers, movie-based games, and more. And with Bonus View, you can enjoy "picture-in-picture" capability with select Blu-ray titles. External memory (sold separately) is required. 
 * Quick Start Mode: Quick Start Mode lets you begin operating your Sony Blu-ray Disc player approximately six seconds from the time it's powered on. 
 * Ethernet port lets you connect the BDP-S360 to your home's existing broadband network to access bonus features on BD-Live enabled Blu-ray Disc movies. 
 * Bonus View feature provides "picture-in-picture" capability with select Blu-ray Disc titles--useful for viewing director or actor commentary while the movie plays. 
 * x.v.Color output plays AVCHD-format discs with support for the international xvYCC color standard, producing images with nearly twice as many viewable colors as the existing RGB color standard. 
 * BRAVIA Sync technology lets you enjoy the convenience of one remote control to operate and control all your compatible home entertainment devices. It utilizes the HDMI CEC function to easily turn on and control your compatible HDMI-connected components without having to use multiple remote controls. 
 * 24p True Cinema technology lets you watch films at their intended 24 fps (frames per second)--the way movies are shot and mastered--so you can enjoy cinematic picture quality. 
 * Precision Cinema HD Upscale circuitry delivers accurate and vivid images with clarity and detail that are faithful to the source--whether film or video (upscaled image quality will vary). This circuitry uses advanced conversion and processing to detect image changes at the pixel level, rather than at the level of whole scan lines. Additionally, separate algorithms are used to process the moving and still parts of an image, resulting in sharp backgrounds with moving objects that are free from motion artifacts. 
 * Emmy-Award Winning Xross Media Bar Interface: Sony's exclusive xross media bar user interface makes it simple and intuitive to navigate television menus, controls, and user settings. (Learn more) 
 * x.v.Color output plays AVCHD-format discs with support for the international xvYCC color standard, producing images with nearly twice as many viewable colors as the existing RGB color standard. (Learn more) 
 * Easy Wi-Fi setup: In addition to a built-in Ethernet port, the BDP-N460 includes built-in software that makes it easy to connect this player to your existing wireless network by pairing the optional Linksys Wireless Ethernet Bridge (WET-610N) to connect to your home router (each sold separately). Or you can use the built-in Ethernet port to use a wired connection. 
 * Convenience features include parental controls, child lock, and video bit rate indicator 
 * Dimensions: 16.9 x 2.2 x 8.1 inches 
 * Warranty: 1 year parts and labor 

Connections


 * HDMI audio/video output: 1 
 * Component video (Y/Pb/Pr) output: 1 
 * Composite video output: 1 
 * Optical digital audio output: 1 
 * Coaxial digital audio output: 1 
 * Analog audio output: 1 (2-channel) 
 * Ethernet networking: 1 
 * USB port: 1 

Video Specifications


 * AVC-HD: Yes (8cm/12cm; DVD+R/RW/-R/-RW) 
 * BD-R/RE Read Compatibility: Yes (BDMV & BDAV) 
 * BD-ROM: Bonus View (Profile1.1); BD-Live (Profile2.0); BD-ROM (SL/DL) 
 * CD (CD-DA): Yes 
 * CD-R/RW: Yes (CD-DA & Data) 
 * DVD Playback: Yes 
 * DVD+R Read Compatibility: Yes (DL) (+VR) 
 * DVD+RW Read Compatibility: Yes (+VR) (8cm) 
 * DVD-R Read Compatibility: Yes (DL) (VR) (VR with CPRM) (8cm) 
 * DVD-RW Read Compatibility: Yes (VR) (VR with CPRM) (8cm) 
 * JPEG Playback: Yes (BD-R/REDVD+RW/+R/-RW/-R/CD-R,RW) 
 * Noise Reduction: Yes 
 * PhotoTV HD: Yes 
 * x.v.Color Technology: Yes 

Audio Specifications


 * Dolby: Yes & Dolby TrueHD bitstream out over HDMI (V1.3) 
 * Dolby Digital plus Decoding: Yes 
 * Dolby True HD bitstream output: Yes 
 * Dolby TrueHD Decoding: Yes 
 * LPCM: Yes (multi channel decoder): Yes (HDMI bitstream out) 
 * MP3 Playback: Yes (BD-R/RE/DVD+RW/+R/-RW/-R/CD-R,RW) 
 * dts Decoding: Yes 
 * dts HD bitstream output: Yes 
 * dts Output: Yes, & /DTS-HD bitstream out over HDMI (V1.3) 

What's in the Box
Sony BDP-N460 BD player, remote control (with 2 AA batteries), composite video cable, AC cable, printed instruction manual




LEARN MORE



PREMIUM ONLINE ENTERTAINMENT STREAMING
Instantly stream thousands of movies, videos and music from an ever-growing list of over 25 content providers including Netflix (coming Fall 2009), Slacker Radio, YouTube and more. Just connect the BDP-N460 to your existing internet connection and enjoy the convenience of instant streaming. Content providers include:  

 * Netflix 
 * YouTube 
 * Blip.tv 
 * Crackle 
 * Video Detective 
 * Slacker 
 * Concierge.com 
 * Fear.net 

 * Men.Style.com 
 * Wired 
 * SingingFool.com 
 * Style.com 
 * Dailymotion 
 * Videocast.com 
 * On Networks 

 * My Play 
 * eHow 
 * Golflink.com 
 * Howcast 
 * Epicurious 
 * Livestrong.com 
 * Sony Pictures Television 
 * Ford Models 







MORE PICTURE
See Everything Your HDTV Can Show You with Full HD.

6 Times the Picture Data on DVDs
See everything your HDTV can show you. Blu-ray Disc's Full HD 1080p resolution produces over 2 million pixels per frame to produce a razor-sharp picture with unmatched depth and clarity that takes full advantage of the capabilities of today's 1080p HDTVs. That's six times the picture data contained on DVDs, which are encoded at only 480p.

24p True Cinema Video Output
Most of all Hollywood movies are shot at 24 frames per second, and Blu-ray Disc movies are mastered at 24 frame per second, so it is only fitting that the Sony Blu-ray Disc Players can output your films at 1080/24p for a true film-like experience at home. Of course, Sony Blu-ray Disc Players can also output at 1080/60p for more traditional HDTV sets on the market. Either way Sony has you covered for the best picture possible in Full 1080p.


Backwards compatible and Upscaling
All existing Blu-ray Disc players will play your standard DVD collection without a problem. And with built-in 1080p video upscaling, they'll look even better.







MORE SOUND
This Sony BD player is compatible with Dolby TrueHD, Dolby’s next-generation lossless technology developed for high-definition disc-based media. Dolby TrueHD delivers tantalizing sound that is bit-for-bit identical to the studio master, unlocking the true high-definition entertainment experience on next-generation discs. When coupled with high-definition video, Dolby TrueHD offers an unprecedented home theater experience that lets you enjoy sound as stunning as the high-definition picture.  * Delivers enthralling studio-master-quality sound that unlocks the true high-definition entertainment experience on next-generation discs. 
 * Offers more discrete channels than ever before for impeccable surround sound. 
 *  Compatible with the A/V receivers and home-theaters-in-a-box (HTIBs) of today and tomorrow. 
 *  Dialogue normalization maintains the same volume level when you change to other Dolby Digital and Dolby TrueHD programming. 
 * Dynamic range control (Night mode) enables you to customize audio playback to reduce peak volume levels (no loud surprises) while experiencing all the details in the soundtrack, enabling late-night viewing of high-energy surround sound without disturbing others. 





XROSS MEDIA BAR
Xross (pronounced Cross) is Sony's Technical-Emmy award-winning graphic user interface for Sony WEGA and BRAVIA televisions and PS3 and PSX game systems. The interface features category icons spread horizontally across the screen that organize the viewing options (TV, Music, Internet, Tools, etc...). When a category icon is selected on the horizontal bar, a vertical bar appears showing the viewing options within that category. Using the directional pad on your remote, you can easily maneuver horizontally from category to category, then scroll vertically through individual viewing options to easily navigate through the wide range of programming available on today's televisions. 



X.V COLOR
Thanks to the adoption of a newly approved international color standard called xvYCC (an option in the HDMI v1.3 spec and which Sony participated in creating), the color space has been greatly expanded.

All Sony XBR HDTVs support the xvYCC color profile (Extended YCC Colorimetry for Video Applications), or "x.v. color" for short. Standard RGB color space allows the display of a portion of the colors that are viewable to the human eye. The next generation "xvYCC" color space actually offers an available range of colors that exceeds what human eyes can recognize.  * Next-generation "xvYCC" color space supports 1.8 times as many colors as existing HDTV signals
 * Lets HDTVs display colors more accurately
 * Enables displays with more natural and vivid colors

Plays Blu-ray Disc movies in Full HD 1080p
Upscales DVDs to near high definition
Plays Blu-ray Disc movies in Full HD 1080p
Instantly streams online entertainment from leading providers
